speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: SCENE IV. Another part of the forest.

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: Enter VALENTINE

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: How use doth breed a habit in a man!

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: This shadowy desert, unfrequented woods,

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: I better brook than flourishing peopled towns:

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Here can I sit alone, unseen of any,

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: And to the nightingale's complaining notes

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Tune my distresses and record my woes.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: O thou that dost inhabit in my breast,

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Leave not the mansion so long tenantless,

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Lest, growing ruinous, the building fall

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: And leave no memory of what it was!

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Repair me with thy presence, Silvia;

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Thou gentle nymph, cherish thy forlorn swain!

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: What halloing and what stir is this to-day?

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: These are my mates, that make their wills their law,

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Have some unhappy passenger in chase.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: They love me well; yet I have much to do

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: To keep them from uncivil outrages.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Withdraw thee, Valentine: who's this comes here?

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Enter PROTEUS, SILVIA, and JULIA

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Madam, this service I have done for you,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Though you respect not aught your servant doth,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: To hazard life and rescue you from him

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: That would have forced your honour and your love;

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Vouchsafe me, for my meed, but one fair look;

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: A smaller boon than this I cannot beg

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: And less than this, I am sure, you cannot give.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: [Aside]  How like a dream is this I see and hear!

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Love, lend me patience to forbear awhile.

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: O miserable, unhappy that I am!

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Unhappy were you, madam, ere I came;

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: But by my coming I have made you happy.

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: By thy approach thou makest me most unhappy.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: [Aside]  And me, when he approacheth to your presence.

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: Had I been seized by a hungry lion,

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: I would have been a breakfast to the beast,

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: Rather than have false Proteus rescue me.

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: O, Heaven be judge how I love Valentine,

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: Whose life's as tender to me as my soul!

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: And full as much, for more there cannot be,

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: I do detest false perjured Proteus.

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: Therefore be gone; solicit me no more.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: What dangerous action, stood it next to death,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Would I not undergo for one calm look!

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: O, 'tis the curse in love, and still approved,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: When women cannot love where they're beloved!

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: When Proteus cannot love where he's beloved.

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: Read over Julia's heart, thy first best love,

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: For whose dear sake thou didst then rend thy faith

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: Into a thousand oaths; and all those oaths

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: Descended into perjury, to love me.

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: Thou hast no faith left now, unless thou'dst two;

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: And that's far worse than none; better have none

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: Than plural faith which is too much by one:

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: Thou counterfeit to thy true friend!

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: In love

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Who respects friend?

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: All men but Proteus.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Nay, if the gentle spirit of moving words

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Can no way change you to a milder form,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: I'll woo you like a soldier, at arms' end,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: And love you 'gainst the nature of love,--force ye.

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: O heaven!

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: I'll force thee yield to my desire.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Ruffian, let go that rude uncivil touch,

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Thou friend of an ill fashion!

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Valentine!

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Thou common friend, that's without faith or love,

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: For such is a friend now; treacherous man!

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Thou hast beguiled my hopes; nought but mine eye

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Could have persuaded me: now I dare not say

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: I have one friend alive; thou wouldst disprove me.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Who should be trusted, when one's own right hand

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Is perjured to the bosom? Proteus,

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: I am sorry I must never trust thee more,

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: But count the world a stranger for thy sake.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: The private wound is deepest: O time most accurst,

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: 'Mongst all foes that a friend should be the worst!

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: My shame and guilt confounds me.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Forgive me, Valentine: if hearty sorrow

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Be a sufficient ransom for offence,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: I tender 't here; I do as truly suffer

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: As e'er I did commit.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Then I am paid;

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: And once again I do receive thee honest.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Who by repentance is not satisfied

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Is nor of heaven nor earth, for these are pleased.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: By penitence the Eternal's wrath's appeased:

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: And, that my love may appear plain and free,

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: All that was mine in Silvia I give thee.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: O me unhappy!

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Swoons

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Look to the boy.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Why, boy! why, wag! how now! what's the matter?

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Look up; speak.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: O good sir, my master charged me to deliver a ring

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: to Madam Silvia, which, out of my neglect, was never done.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Where is that ring, boy?

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Here 'tis; this is it.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: How! let me see:

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Why, this is the ring I gave to Julia.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: O, cry you mercy, sir, I have mistook:

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: This is the ring you sent to Silvia.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: But how camest thou by this ring? At my depart

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: I gave this unto Julia.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: And Julia herself did give it me;

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: And Julia herself hath brought it hither.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: How! Julia!

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Behold her that gave aim to all thy oaths,

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: And entertain'd 'em deeply in her heart.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: How oft hast thou with perjury cleft the root!

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: O Proteus, let this habit make thee blush!

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Be thou ashamed that I have took upon me

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Such an immodest raiment, if shame live

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: In a disguise of love:

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: It is the lesser blot, modesty finds,

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Women to change their shapes than men their minds.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Than men their minds! 'tis true.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: O heaven! were man

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: But constant, he were perfect. That one error

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Fills him with faults; makes him run through all the sins:

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Inconstancy falls off ere it begins.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: What is in Silvia's face, but I may spy

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: More fresh in Julia's with a constant eye?

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Come, come, a hand from either:

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Let me be blest to make this happy close;

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: 'Twere pity two such friends should be long foes.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Bear witness, Heaven, I have my wish for ever.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: And I mine.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Enter Outlaws, with DUKE and THURIO

speaker: Outlaws
text_entry: A prize, a prize, a prize!

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Forbear, forbear, I say! it is my lord the duke.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Your grace is welcome to a man disgraced,

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Banished Valentine.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Sir Valentine!

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: Yonder is Silvia; and Silvia's mine.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Thurio, give back, or else embrace thy death;

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Come not within the measure of my wrath;

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Do not name Silvia thine; if once again,

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Verona shall not hold thee. Here she stands;

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Take but possession of her with a touch:

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: I dare thee but to breathe upon my love.

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: Sir Valentine, I care not for her, I;

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: I hold him but a fool that will endanger

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: His body for a girl that loves him not:

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: I claim her not, and therefore she is thine.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: The more degenerate and base art thou,

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: To make such means for her as thou hast done

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: And leave her on such slight conditions.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Now, by the honour of my ancestry,

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: I do applaud thy spirit, Valentine,

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: And think thee worthy of an empress' love:

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Know then, I here forget all former griefs,

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Cancel all grudge, repeal thee home again,

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Plead a new state in thy unrivall'd merit,

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: To which I thus subscribe: Sir Valentine,

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Thou art a gentleman and well derived;

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Take thou thy Silvia, for thou hast deserved her.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: I thank your grace; the gift hath made me happy.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: I now beseech you, for your daughter's sake,

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: To grant one boom that I shall ask of you.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: I grant it, for thine own, whate'er it be.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: These banish'd men that I have kept withal

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Are men endued with worthy qualities:

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Forgive them what they have committed here

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: And let them be recall'd from their exile:

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: They are reformed, civil, full of good

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: And fit for great employment, worthy lord.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Thou hast prevail'd; I pardon them and thee:

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Dispose of them as thou know'st their deserts.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: Come, let us go: we will include all jars

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: With triumphs, mirth and rare solemnity.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: And, as we walk along, I dare be bold

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: With our discourse to make your grace to smile.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: What think you of this page, my lord?

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: I think the boy hath grace in him; he blushes.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: I warrant you, my lord, more grace than boy.

speaker: DUKE
text_entry: What mean you by that saying?

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Please you, I'll tell you as we pass along,

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: That you will wonder what hath fortuned.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Come, Proteus; 'tis your penance but to hear

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: The story of your loves discovered:

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: That done, our day of marriage shall be yours;

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: One feast, one house, one mutual happiness.

speaker: VALENTINE
text_entry: Exeunt
